question.body: When would you conclude that the average number of miles driven per year is less than 12,000?

multiple_choice.choice: When the p-value is large (more than 0.05)
When the p-value is small (less than 0.05)
When the average number of miles is less than 12,000

response.feedback: Incorrect. While we can never accept the null hypothesis, we can accept the alternative hypothesis if there is sufficient evidence. Please try again.
Incorrect. If the p-value is > 0.05 we would not reject the null hypothesis. This question is asking when we would reject the null hypothesis. Please try again.
Correct. We can accept Ha if there is sufficient evidence, namely that the p-value < 0.05.

Incorrect. The key issue is whether the average number of miles is a significant amount less than 12,000. Sometimes, even though the average is less than 12,000, we would not reject the null hypothesis in favor of the alternative hypothesis. Please try again.
